intro: Pachystela conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed milkvine, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are arranged in racemose inflorescences. Its fruit is a legume that contains several seeds, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Pachystela conferta is notable for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and its role in supporting local pollinators.
